title: Contingency Planning - AI Probing Questions
description: Questions for Day 4 contingency planning session covering stuck pipe, lost circulation, weather, equipment failure

questions.question: Stuck pipe response shows jarring as first option - how many jar runs do you have on board?
If you have to sidetrack, what's your casing contingency and do you have the equipment?
Lost circulation shows cement squeeze as final option - what's your squeeze design and do you have materials?
Weather downtime contingency shows 5 days supplies - worst case storm is 7 days. What's your plan?
If top drive fails, can you continue drilling with rotary table?
Fishing equipment list shows an overshot and spear - are these dressed for your pipe sizes?
What's your decision tree for when stuck pipe becomes a fishing job vs sidetrack?
If MWD fails and you're in a critical steering section, can you continue blind or must you trip?
Emergency disconnect is planned if vessel moves off station - what's your reconnect procedure?
If cementing fails and you have communication, what's your remedial timeline and does it fit the drilling schedule?
Your contingency plan references shore-based support - what's the response time for getting specialist equipment to rig?
Medevac is helicopter but weather limits helicopter operations - what's your backup medevac plan?
If you have a BOP failure requiring repair, what's your well suspension procedure and barrier status?
Differential sticking contingency shows spotting fluid - what volume, what type, and how long to mix?
If supply vessel is delayed 48 hours, which critical materials run out first?
